CatDescriptText: Mr. Oliver Fletcher, 7224 Mount Vernon Street, was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, November 23, 1957, pg. 10 with question: "Do you think Negroes in Pittsburgh use their economic power wisely?" answer reads: "Some do and some don't. For instance, some Negroes who have money, instead of having a decent place, have just a joint.  Overall, I would say that the majority of Negroes do use their economic power wisely, especially those who live in Homewood, where I live."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Oliver Fletcher wearing moustache, hat, zippered jacket and coat with corduroy collar, seated with arms folded against metal object, railroad tracks in background
